ursabot commented on pull request #12079:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12079#issuecomment-1011440814


   Benchmark runs are scheduled for baseline = bafaa76bad81c047b471071ce46245d261b62b97 and contender = b582af1771a84ae3a13438cf721f5c13c3bcff2a. b582af1771a84ae3a13438cf721f5c13c3bcff2a is a master commit associated with this PR. Results will be available as each benchmark for each run completes.
   Conbench compare runs links:
   [Scheduled] [ec2-t3-xlarge-us-east-2](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/e2bee146f95a4722a372ff41a84d19d0...1a09b808f25d416e94ddd5009ffc170c/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-i9-9960x](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/6c557b7204d0430c83e7f333020a3a8a...7a14661cf6c94196bfefbc2b1a6170f8/)
   [Scheduled] [ursa-thinkcentre-m75q](https://conbench.ursa.dev/compare/runs/d461789737b4457db6f6e78958bf0c06...21e22f7d4a934bb6a7f44d7bb86b4b3b/)
   Supported benchmarks:

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
The homebrew-r-autobrew nightly job has been failing since the AWS SDK version was bumped in the autobrew/homebrew-core repo. 

I don't think we can move to this newer version yet due to https://github.com/aws/aws-sdk-cpp/issues/1809 so I've opened https://github.com/autobrew/homebrew-core/issues/97 to see if Jeroen has better/different ideas about how to work around this.
